Home.About: @:Common.AppName provides different tool modules to help with Plex Server management.
Home.Name: Home
Home.Title: Welcome to @:Common.AppName
Home.LangUpdateMsg: {0} Language has been updated on the translation site
Home.LangUpdateMsg2: Please go to Language option and select '{0}'

Language.Description: @:Common.Language.Name allows you to change language used by this app
Language.Name: Language
Language.LangMissing: My language is missing from above
Language.LangMissing1: if your language is missing in list above, then unfortunately nobody has translated it, yet.
Language.LangMissing2: If so, we urge you to not only help us, but also your fellow countryfolk using Plex.
Language.LangMissing3: Please visit the link below to sign up as a translator!
Language.LangMissing4: Doing so, will also list you in the about page ;)
Language.LangSpelling1: If so, we urge you to join the translation site as well.
Language.LangProcent: What does the number after the language mean?
Language.LangProcent1: The number indicates how complete the translation is
Language.LangProcent2: If not on 100%, then we need your help
Language.LangForce1: It updates your translations with the latest version available

Login.UsernamePrompt: Enter your plex.tv Username or Email
Login.twoFAPrompt: If using 2FA, enter your code here, else leave as blank (optional)
Login.LoginConnectErrToken: Could not connect to plex.tv with a Token

Update.Title: Update detected
Update.Skip: Hide notification and skip this version

Common.ErrorNoOutDirMsg: You need to define an output directory in the global settings page first
Common.PPReq: {0} needs a valid Plex pass to work

Global.Info: The global settings are divided into the following:
Global.ttLibmap: Define mapped/mounted drives for your Plex Media Server Libraries
Global.ttPMS: General settings for accessing a Plex Media Server
Global.ttExport: Define format for an exported file

General.Name: General Settings
General.Description: @:Common.Settings.General.Name allows you to set general preferences for @:Common.AppName

LibMapping.Name: Library Mapping
LibMapping.Description: @:Common.Settings.LibMapping.Name allows you to map the defined Library folder paths to match a path for this workstation
LibMapping.ttSelectLibrary: Here you select the library to map

PMS.Name: PMS Settings
PMS.Description: @:Common.Settings.PMS.Name allows you to set preferences for accessing a Plex Media Server

Export.Name: Export Settings
Export.Description: @:Common.Settings.Export.Name allows you to set preferences for exporting a file

ET.Description: @:Modules.ET.Name allows you to export detail information about the media in your libraries
ET.Name: ExportTools

Settings.Description: Here you can define the settings for @:Modules.ET.Name
Settings.ArraySep: Delimiter for multiple data in the same field
Settings.ColumnSep: Delimiter between columns in CSV file (Use 9 for TAB)
Settings.TimeOut: Timeout when requesting info from PMS in sec (Global setting)
Settings.NotAvailIndicator: What to use if a field cannot be found
Settings.QualifierCSV: Qualifier to use with a text based field for CSV (Use space for none)
Settings.Posters_Dimensions_TT: Enter the Poster width*height for 'Export Posters'. Comma separated values for multiple exports are permitted. E.G. `75*75, 1024*768` Note: dimensions might be altered slightly in order to preserve the aspect ratio of the posters
Settings.Art_Dimensions_TT: Enter the Art width*height for 'Export Art'. Comma separated values for multiple exports are permitted  E.G. `75*75, 1024*768`. Note: dimensions might be altered slightly in order to preserve the aspect ratio of the art
Settings.suggestedFileNoExtra: For suggested filename, strip extra info from filenames so only essential info is kept
Settings.suggestedUseOrigenTitle: When suggesting file or foldername, use original title
Settings.MoviesUseId: Default Id for suggested folder and filename for movies
Settings.ttMoviesUseId: If exporting Suggested Filename or Folder for movies, default to selected naming if available. Fallback to IMDB if not
Settings.ShowsUseId: Default Id for suggested folder and filename for shows
Settings.ttShowsUseId: If exporting Suggested Filename or Folder for shows, default to selected naming if available. Fallback to TMDB if not
Settings.Name: @:Modules.ET.Name Settings
Settings.Note: Note: * Click here for general settings regarding export *
Settings.NoTimeStamp: Don't add a timestamp to export file name
Settings.NoItemRange: Don't add item range to export file name
Settings.ArtPostersOrigen: Export Art and Posters in original size
Settings.ExportPostersArtsTree: Export Art and Posters in a folder tree

ET.LevelInfo: Export level determines which data is going to be exported.
ET.ErrorBadSep: Column separator can only be one character
ET.ErrorNoServerSelectedMsg: You need to select a server to export from

Custom.Title: Custom levels
Custom.Description: A custom level allows you to create your own export levels
Custom.DeleteLevel: Do you want to delete the selected level?
Custom.NewLevelTitle: Enter name for the new level
Custom.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {0}
Custom.TT-ETEditLevel: Here you select the level to create/delete/edit
Custom.TT-CustType: Here you select the type of export you want to customize

ET.TT-ETPType: Here you select the type of playlist you want to export

optExpType.ttExpLevel: Here you select the values you want to export
optExpType.ttExpLibrary: Here you select the library to export
optExpType.ttExpTypeSec: Here you select the sub type
optExpType.ttExpType: Here you select the type of library you want to export
optExpType.itemEnd: The ending item (Normally the last item in the library)
optExpType.startStopDesc: Here you have the option to define what item to start exporting with,
optExpType.startStopDesc2: as well as what item to stop at.
optExpType.startStopDesc3: Use this to split export files into smaller chunks (files) if needed.

ET.ErrorNoOutputFormatMsg: You need to select an output format in the @:Modules.ET.Name settings, like csv or xlsx

About.Name: About us and credits
About.Devdane22: Tommy (aka dane22), a Plex community member (ukdtom on GitHub)
About.DevCPSO: Casper (aka CPSO), a Plex community member (CPSO on GitHub)
About.TranslationBetaTestersText: A huge thanks goes out to all the people who helped in translating and testing @:Common.AppName
About.PlexPoCredits: And many thanks to the authors/developers and staff at Plex. We are eternally grateful for your dedication, talent and hard work! And to our friends at POEditor.com, who provide a free translation site because we are an Open-Source project.
About.API-Credit: Huge thanks also goes to {0} for providing a beautiful API for free, since we are a non profit project.
About.POE-Credit: And to our friends at POEditor.com, who provide a free translation site because we are an Open-Source project.
About.POE-SignUp: You can help translate our work
About.Plex-Credit: Many thanks to the authors/developers and staff at Plex. We are eternally grateful for your dedication, talent and hard work!
About.PMS-Download: You can download Plex Media server

GlobalSettings.Title: Global Settings
GlobalSettings.Description: Here you configure the global settings, which influence all modules
GlobalSettings.TimeOut: Timeout when requesting info from PMS in sec
GlobalSettings.LogLevelFile: Log level to use (Change only if asked by the devs)
GlobalSettings.LogLevelConsole: Console log level (Only used when developing)
GlobalSettings.RestartNeeded: When changing this setting, a restart is needed
GlobalSettings.FactoryResetWarning: Factory Reset will reset this app to the defaults, as when first installed
GlobalSettings.TTBetaTester: When selected, you'll be notified when a new beta version is available
GlobalSettings.Update: Subscribe to updates (If false, beta updates will also be disabled)
GlobalSettings.TTUpdate: When selected, you'll be notified when a new update is available
GlobalSettings.FactoryResetConfirmBody: Doing a Factory Reset will erase all your settings, as it was when first installed.
GlobalSettings.FactoryResetConfirmBody2: After doing a Factory Reset, you must close and restart {0}
GlobalSettings.TTContainerSize: Amount of items to fetch from the server. Warning: Increasing this will add stress to the server

PMS.Name: Plex Media Server
PMS.Description: @:Modules.PMS.Name modules allow you to manage your server
PMS.ErrorNoServerSelectedMsg: You need to select a server on the top of the screen

Settings.Description: Here you can define the settings for the selected server
Settings.TTSelectSettingsSelection: Here you select the group that the setting you want to alter is in
Settings.Notice: Note: When changing a server setting you might need to restart the server afterwards
Settings.varning: Change at your own risk. Any change can lead to malfunction of your plex server
Settings.TTSettingsFilter: Here you apply a filter for the settings
Settings.ExportGroupSettings: Export selected group settings to CSV
Settings.Name: Server Settings

Butler.Title: Butler Scheduled Tasks
Butler.Description: Here you can kickstart a scheduled task
Butler.SelectTask: Select the scheduled task to run now
Butler.TTSelectTask: Here you select among the scheduled tasks that can be started now
Butler.TaskStarted: The selected task has been started
Butler.TaskDetails: To follow progress, see Plex WebClient Dashboard
Butler.Name: Butler Scheduled Tasks

DVR.Name: DVR
DVR.Description: @:Modules.PMS.DVR.Name module allows you to backup and restore your DVR settings
DVR.ttselDVR: Here you select the DVR you want to make a backup of
DVR.restoreMsg: Are you sure you want to restore the DVR named: '{0}'
DVR.selAlredyPresentMsg: The selected DVR: '{0}' already exist on your PMS. So we will abort
DVR.selMissingDevice: The selected backup file is missing devices
DVR.selDeviceAlreadyUsed: The device is already in use with an existing DVR

PMS.Select: To use a module select it in the side menu

ViewState.Name: View state Copy
ViewState.Description: @:Modules.PMS.ViewState.Name module allows you to copy a list of viewed media from one user to another user on the same server. Note: It's important, that both users have access to the media
ViewState.ttSelSourceUsr: Here you select the user you want to copy view states from
ViewState.ttSelTargetUsr: Here you select the user you want to copy view states to

FindMedia.Name: Find Media
FindMedia.Description: @:Modules.PMS.FindMedia.Name module allows you to search both filesystem and Plex database to locate media missing from either of them
FindMedia.TTSelectLibrary: Select library to check for missing media
FindMedia.MissingMapDesc: One or more paths for the library are not defined. Goto '@:Common.Menu.Sidebar.Settings.NavTitle' and select '@:Common.Settings.LibMapping.Name' to correct

Settings.Name: Find Media Settings
Settings.Description: @:Modules.PMS.FindMedia.Name settings allow you to customize how @:Modules.PMS.FindMedia.Name works
Settings.Note: Note: After changing a setting, please restart @:Common.AppName
Settings.Ext: Comma separated file extensions to look for
Settings.ignoreDirs: Comma separated list of directories to skip
Settings.NoteLibMap: Note: * Click here for general settings regarding @:Common.Menu.Sidebar.PMS.LibMapping *

PlexTV.Name: Plex.TV
PlexTV.Description: @:Modules.PlexTV.Name module allows you get details about users you are sharing with
PlexTV.TT-User: Here you select the user to get more info about
PlexTV.UsrHome: Is the user part of your Home

Download.Name: Download
Download.Description: The @:Modules.Download.Name module allows you to download media.
Download.Description2: To use this module, the server owner MUST grant you Download rights and you need to have an active Plex Pass. Server owner imposed bandwidth limits are respected. Please be respectful when setting your bandwidth limits in Download settings. You can stop/resume the download/s at any time
Download.ttServer: Select the server to download from
Download.ttLibrary: Select the library to download from

Queue.Name: @:Modules.Download.Name Queue
Queue.Description: Here you see and edit the items queued for download

Settings.Name: @:Modules.Download.Name Settings
Settings.Description: Here you can define the settings for @:Modules.Download.Name
Settings.ttDownloadMaxBandWidth: Here you select the maximum bandwith to use when downloading. Don't use maximum, unless you want to lose your friend. Also note, that maximum bandwidth can not exceed what the server owner has set
Settings.ttDownloadMaxErrors: Maximum errors allowed before showing a warning
Settings.ttDownloadTimeout: Timeout in seconds waiting for server response
